intro: Specularia pentagonia var. pubescens, commonly known as the pubescent pentagon bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive pentagonal-shaped flowers, which are typically pink or purple in color. The plant features hairy, glandular leaves that give it its varietal name, "pubescens." It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This species is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
